identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of Robot-assisted Gait Training According to Gait Speed in Participants With Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Comparison of Robot-assisted Gait Training According to Gait Speed in Participants With Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Comparison of the experimental group that applied the speed of the robot-assisted gait training constantly and the control group that applied the gradual increase of the speed of the robot-assisted gait training.

armGroups.label: Constant gait speed group
armGroups.description: experimental group that applied the speed of the robot-assisted gait training constantly

armGroups.label: Increasing gait speed group
armGroups.description: control group that applied the gradual increase of the speed of the robot-assisted gait training

interventions.name: Constant gait speed group
interventions.description: The speed of the robot-assisted gait treatment is constantly applied for 5 times a week for 2 weeks.

interventions.name: Increasing gait speed group
interventions.description: The speed of the robot-assisted gait treatment is gradually increase for 5 times a week for 2 weeks.

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline
baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: the amount of oxygen consumed while sitting at rest and is equal to 3.5 ml O2 per kg body weight x min
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: oxygenated hemoglobin concentration of cortical activation
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: deoxygenated hemoglobin concentration of cortical activation
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: Fugl-Meyer Assessment uses to examine the motor function and coordination of affected lower extremity. It includes 17 items of a 3-point ordinal scale, ranging 0-34, with higher scores indicating lower impairment.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: Functional Ambulation Category is used to assess gait ability with 6 levels ranging from 0 to 5 on the basis of the amount of physical support required, regardless of use of an assistive device
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: 10m walk test is used to examine gait speed, in which participant was asked to walk on a 14 meter of walkway wearing harness with two conditions; with the fastest speed or with self-selected comfortable speed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: simple test used to assess a person's mobility and requires both static and dynamic balance
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 1 weeks after baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 3 weeks after baseline

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiplegic patients secondary to first cerebrovascular accidents
* Functional ambulation category score â‰¥ 3

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of surgery of affected lower limb
* Fracture of affected lower limb
